Posts.Content: Hi volvox I had mastectomy and no recon.  I’m back to my spin and swimming (10 weeks later) and was pretty good after 3weeks.  I was lucky as I healed well with no infections and my arm mobility came back after a couple of weeks as I was so focused on the arm exercises (which I still do).  I’m living with one breast and it’s actua quite easy, I sometimes wish I’d had the other one off as well to balance everything up, although I may consider the diep flap later. I think it all depends on what stage of life you are at and the type of cancer etc.  It’s so difficult to make these decisions whilst you’re in the thick of it!  I just wanted to reassure you that one breast is doable. Hoping for the best for you and a big hug xxx

Posts.Title: Having a mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Pussycatgirl I am 4 weeks post mastectomy op and I'm feeling really good.  In the end I couldn't wait to get the darn thing off (it's a relief to be honest). The op is realively simple and in my case (no reconstruction)  healing has been quick i.e.  I only had my drain in for 2 days whereas it's a fair bit longer if you have recon at same time).  I haven't discounted recon but my main objective was to get rid of the tumours and focus on getting better first.   Mostly I am at ease with it all, although I have noticed it takes others around me much longer to adjust I.e hubby/daughter/colleagues. One friend burst into tears when she came around to visit, which I really wasn't expecting?? I know I will have to work on how I feel as a female as right now I don't see myself as 'sexual' although I would have done pre op.  I've been looking around at mastectomy lingerie to see if this might help. I do wear my knitted knocker everyday from a shape/symmetry perspective.  It's lovely and soft and so doesn't irritate the scar.  It has been an excellent standby whilst I wait for my prosthesis fitting (6 weeks post surgery).   Hope this helps cords

Posts.Title: todays post surgery update

Posts.Content: Hi Crawford I had mastectomy just over 2 months ago, and I did feel tired over the first week.  I took to napping in the afternoons (something I never normally do).  I was also on tramodol which knocked me out at night.  I came off the tramodol after a week as I thought it too strong for me and I just stuck to paracetamol.  I never felt cold or shivery, mind you I was recovering during August!  I did have shingles type pain around my back near the arm...apparently this is normal due to the 'nerve endings'.   I hope this helps in terms of benchmarking experiences, thing is we're all different so who knows what the 'standard recovery' looks like!!  All the best with the healing, my top tip is be kind to your self and let others help.  I over did it one day lugging heavy shopping around and I really hurt myself...1 step forward, 2 steps backward.   For your reassurance, Im virtually back to normal and I returned to work last week.  Main change to my routine is it takes longer to get ready in the morning (exercises and getting my knitted knocker into place).  I whip my bra off as soon as I get home as it irritates my scar, but that's to be expected. If you're still worried get back in touch with your Bcn, just the reassurance will help and it's entirely understandable. All the best Cords
